Top Hotel Collections Taj Hotels Near Airport 5 Star Hotels Nearby Resorts View All Hotels In Mumbai Top Beaches to Visit Near Mumbai For A Great Vacation While Mumbai itself is a coastal city with many beaches within the city, many of those beaches get crowded and hence not as pleasing. But Thankfully, Mumbai has many nearby beach destinations that ve (Read More)ry well make up for this. If the noise of the city starts getting to you, ditch the seaside venues of this massive coastal metropolis and head on to the more serene beaches near Mumbai, lined up all along the Konkan Coast. The serenity of Kashid, Tarkarli, and Alibag are sure to make you forget your worries as you lose yourself in the beautiful combination of turquoise waters, swaying palm trees and soft sands under your feet. Here is the list of 32 Best Beaches Near Mumbai That Every Tourist Must Visit 1. Kashid Beach 4.3 /5 One of the most popular and alluring beaches near Mumbai, the Kashid beach comes with a promise of a perfect and relaxed beach holiday. The sun kissed, white, clean sandy beach with crystalline water is full of natural beauty that offers a dream destination for water enthusiasts. The Casuarinas groves, which sway to the tune of the gentle sea breeze are also in plenty here. Distance from Mumbai: 124 km Read More 2. Alibaug beach 4.4 /5 View 10+ photos Among the most popular beaches near Mumbai, Alibag aka Alibaug is a coastal town and a municipal council in Raigad District in the Konkan region. It is the headquarters of the Raigad district. Alibag was developed in the 17th century by Sarkhel Kanhoji Aangre the naval chief of King Shivaji's Kingdom. Raigad's first name was "Kulaba". Today's Ramnath was the main village. A Bene Israelite named Ali used to live there at that time. A rich man he was who owned many mango and coconut plantations in his gardens. Hence, the locals used to call the place "Alichi Bagh" meaning "Gardens of Ali", or simply "Alibag", and hence the name stuck. Distance from Mumbai: 95 km Read More 3. Manori Beach 4.2 /5 View 6+ photos Manori, a small village located on Dharavi Bhet in northern Mumbai, is most commonly known for the beautiful Manori Beach and the Manori Creek. If one is looking for a quiet, calm and serene beach in Mumbai, then Manori Beach is the place. It is also relatively cleaner than the other beaches in Mumbai. Essel World, a well-known amusement park in Mumbai, is located at a very small distance from Manori. Fishing activities also occur frequently at the Beach. Distance from Mumbai: 48 km Read More 4. Murud Beach 4.3 /5 A relaxing stretch of glittering white sand, the beach is not as cluttered by tourist rush as are most popular beaches. The combination of the warm water and cool breeze makes complete sense and feels incredible as well. Seeing the sun set behind the forts in the vicinity is a delightful sight. Srivardhan Beach, Harihareshwar 3.2 /5 This beach is nearly 20 km from Harihareshwar. The blackish sand and the sound of the waves attracts many here. Adventure water sports including paragliding, water surfing, etc. can be enjoyed here. Trekking the nearby cliffs of Shrivardhan is also a major attraction for adventure seekers. Distance from Mumbai: 188 km Read More 6. Ganapatipule Beach 4.2 /5 A clean rocky beach with fine silvery white sand, the Ganapatipule beach, is also known for the lagoon it houses. Distance from Mumbai: 333 km Read More 7. Harihareshwar Beach 4.3 /5 Undoubtedly the highlight to the town and its tourism scene, is the Harihareshwar Beach. This beach is a sheer joy to be at - elegant, clean, soothing and soft. The fact that it is relatively unpolluted is quite a delight to all its tourists. Distance from Mumbai: 200 km Read More 8. Nagaon Beach, Alibag 4.3 /5 Tourists from far of places, Mumbai and pune visit nagaon beach due to the clean water, best cottages, water sports and tasty sea food, provided at reasonable prices around the beautiful beach. Nagaon beach acts as the central place for surrounding other beaches like Murud, Kashid, Akshi, Alibaug, Kihim and Mandva. Still nagaon beach is natural and beautiful due to coconut, betel and suru trees. From Mumbai and pune, Nagaon beach is 100 km via road and 60 km from sea. Water sports is new additional entertainment, available at Nagaon beach. There are seven to eight types of boats, available as per tourist demand. Nagaon beach is safe for all kinds of activites as in swimming, boating due to flat surface. Distance from Mumbai: 101 km Read More 9. Mandwa, Alibag 4.3 /5 View 5+ photos The beautiful and mesmerizing Mandwa beach is located 20km north of Alibaug. Located in the vicinity of Gateway of India, the beach can be reached easily via ferries from Gateway of India. Distance from Mumbai: 104 km Read More 10. Diveagar Beach 4.2 /5 View 8+ photos Diveagar aka Dive Agar is located in, Raigad district of Maharashtra which is near about 170 km near Mumbai, is scarcely populated and pretty clean, tidy and peaceful. The area involves a beach, a temple and local businesses engaged in coconut and beetle nut tree farming. Other involvements comprise of some resort businesses such as restaurants, cottage rentals and Hotels, and six villages. Distance from Mumbai: 189 km Read More 11. Kihim beach, Alibag 4.1 /5 View 5+ photos Situated 12 km away from Alibaug, the beach is almost perfect for a beautiful romantic weekend getaway from Mumbai. Distance from Mumbai: 96 km Read More 12. Devka Beach, Daman 3.5 /5 Devka beach is a sight of pure beauty. Like so many other beaches of Daman, this too is a massive, picturesque and quite unspoilt. Distance from Mumbai: 182 km Read More 13. Korlai Beach, Alibag Korlai Beach is one of the hidden gems of Mumbai. Situated at a little distance from the town of Alibaug, the main beach is located in the small fisher village of Korlai. Contrary to the usual sand beaches of Maharashtra, this one full of green-yellow weeds, pink oxalis flowers and grassy meadows during the rainy season. Distance from Mumbai: 115 km Read More 14. Awas Beach, Alibaug Located a little on the outskirts of Alibaug, around 7 kms from Mandwa, Awas Beach is a beautiful stretch of golden sands lined with casuarina and suru trees. A well kept secret of Alibaug, the beach rarely has visitors which means it is ideal for romantic getaways or to spend quality time in solitude. The village adjacent to the beach houses some beautiful resorts which are frequented by families and couples alike. Lack of tourism in the place also lead to cleaner shores, quieter aesthetics and an overall gorgeous view. Distance from Mumbai: 101 km Read More 15. Uran Beach Situated at the end of Navi Mumbai, Uran lies in the Konkan division between Panvel and Karjat. Primarily a tiny fishing and agriculture village, Uran has several beaches to its attribute- the most popular of which are Pirvad, Mankeshwar and ONGC. Surrounded by water bodies on three sides, the village is just attached to the land from the side of Raigarh district. Pirvad is the most frequented beach, with plenty of tourists visiting it every day, Mankeshwar is considered to be a religious beach owing to the grand temple of Lord Shiva situated at the seaside itself. Whereas ONGC is popular for housing the gas plant at the beach. Distance from Mumbai: 48 km Read More 16. Akshi Beach, Alibag 3.7 /5 View 10+ photos Its white sands dotted by numerous Suru trees and an occasional spotting of birds, Akshi Beach at a distance of 5km from Alibaug, is a beach ideal for spending some slow paced, relaxed time as well as bird watching. The water is clean and pristine, making the area ideal for an enjoyable swim. Distance from Mumbai: 101 km Read More 17. Kalamb Beach Located in Nalasopara in Thane district of Maharashtra, is the really long and secluded Kalamb Beach, one of the nearest beaches from Mumbai. A paradise away from the din of the city, the beach is beautiful owing to its tranquility, serenity and an altogether mesmerising panorama. Distance from Mumbai: 67 km Read More 18. Kondivili Beach, Diveagar 3.1 /5 Finally a place for adventure seekers, Kondivili Beach famed for such sport activities is situated about 5 km from Shrivardhan Beach. The poplar activities that you can indulge at this beach are paragliding and surfing. Distance from Mumbai: 188 km Read More 19. Dandi Beach, Gujarat 4.3 /5 Dandi is a popular destination of tourists visiting Surat. Dandi is a place famous in the history of Indian independence movement and has an extremely important significance in the history of our country. Distance from Mumbai: 323 km Read More 20. Hedvi Beach 3.4 /5 Hedvi beach is situated about 3km from the Ganesh Temple. It is famous because of a rock formation that sits on the beach. Bahman Ghal is a large black monolith of about 35 feet high. Distance from Mumbai: 291 km Read More 21. Varsoli Beach, Alibag 3.7 /5 View 10+ photos Parnakuti located in Varsoli village is 1 kilometres from Alibaug city proper. Designed as a comfortable home away from home, the entire cottage can be rented for a weekend. Also available is authentic delicious Konkani food specially catered for your needs, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian. All your needs will be taken care of and the best part is at a great price that won't stretch your wallet at all. Distance from Mumbai: 96 km Read More 22. Revdanda Beach and Fort, Kashid 3.2 /5 The ruins of the Portuguese fort are veiled in wild plantations. What stand out are the cannon holes in the fortification walls that border the sea. Even though the fort is now in ruins, the pure historic charm combined with the nature's exotic beauty - the Ravdanda beach - make this a must visit place. Distance from Mumbai: 125 km Read More 23. Saswane Beach, Alibag 3.0 /5 A relatively lesser known beach near Mumbai, Saswane Beach lies on the coastline extended after Awas and Alibaug. The beach faces an elite residential village with sparse bungalows and posh apartments. With a grove of coconut trees in the distance, the Mumbai skyline presents a mesmerising picture. The beach also encourages water sports (except during monsoon) and is frequented by travellers both from Pune and Mumbai owing to its flexible location. The extremely scenic beach also houses a sculpture museum and boasts of even prettier sunset views. Distance from Mumbai: 102 km Read More 24. Kelshi Beach, Dapoli 3.7 /5 The long stretch of untouched scenic coastal beauty is what makes a trip to Kelshi beach worth the trouble. Approximately three kilometres in length, this gorgeous beach is covered with lush greenery and dense forests, making it a great place for birdwatching in the winters. Distance from Mumbai: 223 km Read More 25. Bhatye beach, Ratnagiri 4.2 /5 View 7+ photos Bhatye is the biggest town in Konkan and one of the immediate suburbs in Ratnagiri with beautiful white sand and bluish water. It gives a beautiful view of the sunset and is an ideal date spot for lovers. It also gives many opportunities for water sports. Distance from Mumbai: 338 km Read More 26. Ganeshgule beach, Ratnagiri 3.1 /5 Situated on the outskirts of Ratnagiri, it surely is a tranquil beach for a calm walk and romantic evenings. One can enjoy a panoramic view of the beautiful sunset. Distance from Mumbai: 357 km Read More 27. Mandavi beach, Ratnagiri 3.1 /5 Most crowded beach of Ratnagiri with a panoramic view of Ratnadurg fort in the west and Arabian sea to the south. It has a vast line of seashore upto Rajiwanda port. Distance from Mumbai: 337 km Read More 28. Kasim Beach, Alibag Located at a distance of around 30 kms from the main town of Alibaug in Kashid, Kasim Beach spells peace, quietude and serenity in all their forms. The beach has an extensive coastline ideal for long walks or simply to sit and bask in the sun. Distance from Mumbai: 96 km Read More 29. Jampore Beach, Daman 3.7 /5 Situated remotely 5 kilometres away from the Moti Daman Jetty, Jampore beach gets fame because of its blackish mud-coloured water. It is soothing just to have glimpses of the sea and is a perfect place for the ones seeking longing peace and solitude. The beach is away from the hustle of the city and is, therefore, a great place to relax. Distance from Mumbai: 177 km Read More 30. Dumas Beach, Surat 4.2 /5 Dumas beach is a very popular destination situated at a distance of 18 kms from Surat city. Travelers recommend this destination for its calming effect and picturesque scenery. Distance from Mumbai: 296 km Read More 31. Madh Island, Mumbai 3.6 /5 Home to umpteen villages, farmlands and surreal vistas, is the locale of Madh Island in Mumbai. Clustered with quaint fisher villages and dotted with lush green farms, Madh Island is a respite from the glitterati and dazzling environs of the city and can be reached by an hour drive from the main city. Distance from Mumbai: 31 km Read More 32. Tarkarli Beach 4.3 /5 View 8+ photos Known for its many beautiful beaches, Tarkarli is an instance of paradise for beach lovers located close enough for a quick weekend trip from Mumbai. With countless beaches such as Tarkarli, Kolam, Achra, one could spend their whole day walking and lazing around and enjoying the various adventurous sports available. What makes the beaches truly magical are the occasional sighting of dolphins. Achra beach also has a 260-year-old Rameshwar temple.
